summary: A letter from U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta to defense attorney Jack Goldberger, notifying him that the U.S. Attorney's Office will proceed with victim notifications for 32 identified victims of Jeffrey Epstein, as required by the Non-Prosecution Agreement. The letter warns that Epstein denying a victim's right to proceed under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255 in a civil suit would constitute a breach of the agreement.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, representing Jeffrey Epstein. The letter discusses victim notifications and obligations under the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Non-Prosecution Agreement. The letter concerns victim notifications related to offenses by him and potential consequences for breaching the agreement.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, representing the U.S. Department of Justice for the Southern District of Florida. He is enforcing the terms of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

connections.description: Goldberger is receiving official correspondence on behalf of Epstein regarding the Non-Prosecution Agreement and victim notifications.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority overseeing the Non-Prosecution Agreement with Epstein.

events.title: Victim List Provided to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provided Jack Goldberger with a list of 31 individuals identified as victims of offenses by Jeffrey Epstein, as required by the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Additional Victim Identified
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office notified the defense that an additional victim had been identified and added to the list, bringing the total to 32.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Notifications
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office planned to distribute victim notifications to all 32 identified victims, either directly or through their counsel.

locations: 300 South Australian Ave., Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office identified 32 victims of offenses by Jeffrey Epstein as part of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
The letter establishes that denying a victim's right to proceed under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255 in a civil suit would be considered a breach of the Non-Prosecution Agreement by Epstein.
U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta personally signed the letter, indicating high-level involvement in enforcing the agreement.
The document reveals procedural steps taken by prosecutors to notify victims, a requirement under the agreement.
Jack Goldberger is listed as the contact person for any civil litigation pursued by the identified victims.
